comments.body:
This doesn't look right - `Axis` is just a union of two strings, but selector will already catch this. What's more, [I don't see this documented.](http://webdriver.io/api/property/getLocation.html)

You should probably get rid of this overload.

Hi @DanielRosenwasser, thanks for taking the time to review this.
It also took me a while and some mistakes to understand this. It's explained in the api [main page](http://webdriver.io/api.html#Element-as-first-citizen) that all functions that receive a `selector` can be used curried if `element` is called first.

Probably there's a better way to model this, but it's out of the scope of this PR.
Should I invert the order of the declarations so `Axis` is before the more general `string` type?

Yeah, I suppose that having the `Axis`-taking overload first would be the most appropriate thing, but long-term there should really be a distinct type with these methods that take an `Axis`. I won't bog you down on this PR, but it'd be ideal if you ever get the chance.
